intro: Psychotria nanarautensis, commonly known as the Nanarautense Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
